questions.question: Which of the following best describes the process of nuclear fission?

choices.answer: separating an atom's electrons from its nucleus
splitting an atom's electrons in half

questions.question: From where do nuclear power plants get uranium?
From the information presented in the movie, what can you infer about neutrons?

choices.answer: they only exist inside uranium atoms
they're where all an atom's energy is stored

questions.question: Place the following events in sequence: A) Uranium atoms split; B) Steam powers turbines; C) Fuel rods heat up
For what reason do nuclear power plants use uranium as fuel?

choices.answer: uranium atomshve nuclei that can be easily split
uranium is less expensive than most other metals
uranium is easier to obtain than most other metals
unlike most other metals, uranium is not radioactive

questions.question: Which of the following terms best describes the byproducts of nuclear power?
Which of the following is an example of a fossil fuel?
What benefit does nuclear energy have over fossil fuels?

choices.answer: it doesn't cause any form of pollution
it can be used to power automobiles
it won't run out as quickly as fossil fuels

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of nuclear fusion?

choices.answer: a plutonium atom is used to start a chain reaction that detonates a weapon
a uranium atom is split apart into lighter elements
two hydrogen atoms are combined to form a helium atom
two hydrogen atoms bond with an oxygen atom to form a water molecule

questions.question: How does nuclear fusion compare to nuclear fission?

choices.answer: A nuclear fusion produces no radioactive waste
nuclear fusion produces more radioactive waste
nuclear fusion is cheaper and easier to produce
nuclear fusion requires rare, expensive elements to work
